Comment: There’s a fundamental difference between “JD Vance got jealous over the popes lively padded sofa and killed the holy father in a lovers quarrel” and “JD Vance has a thing about fucking couches because the kind of females he prefers are so young that their face is out of his line of sight and all he sees are the cushions.”  Both the statements are hyperbolic examples of insults touching on very emotionally fraught topics. But one is clearly hyperbole ad absurdum; no, Ava ce didn’t literally kill the pope.  And the other is hyperbole that comes across as uncomfortably believable, and so causes an emotional reaction (for or against your position, it doesn’t matter which) and ultimately harms the pursuit of logical and rational discussions and solutions.    In other words: “It’s clear that MTG lacks a fundamental baseline understanding of the intricacies of properly serving in her position” is fine. It puts forth an opinion, but that opinion is supported in the statement itself by referencing the various and repeated examples of where she just does a shitty job. “MTG doesn’t actually have any thoughts; her brain was replaced by an AI engine from a secret middle eastern anti Israel alliance, but its first generation tech and full of bugs” is fine. It shares the belief that she is literally incapable of abstract thought, but does so in a hyperbolic way that is applicable but also absurd, not creating any dissonance in the position. “MTG  literally doesn’t think, she’s just basically a flesh suit furby, repeating the most recent phrase said to her” is problematic. It’s clearly and evidentially not true, but it’s close enough to a believable argument that it doesn’t come across as purely absurdist hyperbole, and so the person making that claim has now moved from “the actions she’s taking are harmful” to “she’s stupid”, and there’s no further path there for any form of constructive goal.   If the only thing you want to do is scream impotently into the void, then I guess that sort of statement might suit. But engaging in that behavior in that way is just prolonging the situation. So unless you actively prefer void screaming to, ya know, anything else…
